page.title: 03A LIFETIME IN ALLESLEY cont.
page.content:

When they were younger both men were very much involved in sport - "in those days people had to make their own amusements." Life in Allesley was much quieter then with hardly any cars and no buses. There was a weekly visit from the grocery van - the order was given one week and delivered the next. The only village shops were a butchers and a bakers. The biggest changes in Allesley over the last sixty years are the loss of so many fields to housing and the loss of much wildlife; the increased noise from traffic is also notable. None-the-less both men prefer Allesley as it is today with all the modern ammenities.
